This movie may not be a big rated movie,  the story was very interesting and at times, really had me questioning.  The ending blew me away!  I definitely liked it, it was different but held my interest.

This was a great movie with an exciting twist,, I started off routing for what i thought was a good guy but as the movie progressed I wasn't sure any more who was the good guy and who was the bad, very good writing!!!

An interesting movie with lots of twists set against an upstate New York winter landscape. The problem with the movie is the 2 1/2 hour length. There are many slow scenes that are not needed and the pace could be picked up in many scenes. At least 30 minutes should be trimmed from the running time. The winter scenes in the sleet and snow were very well done.

This movie had me on the edge of my seat.
The acting in this movie was one of the best I've ever seen!  A MUST see!!
I enjoyed it. It was a little cheesy at times but overall I liked it. I love both. Hugh Jackman and Jake Gyllenhaal!

I expected a decent intelligent film, if a bit slow. What I got was a long drawn out unrealistic movie that allowed Hugh Jackman to try to get an oscar.

The world the story takes place is totally unrealistic.

The take away is that rural PA is filled with some creepy people.

A gun would never enter into the interview room.

The initial primary suspect disappears right after the father attacks him in front of a crows including media. Yet, NOBODY investigates the missing suspect.

A detective would not steal evidence from a house like the little camper vehicle.

There are NO neighbors who see anything. Despite having a photo realistic picture of a secondary suspect, NOBODY has ever seen him.

Despite it being a kidnapping, there is no FBI presence at all. Seemingly, the little local PD with 3 or so Officers are the only ones working on a double child kidnapping. Okay dokie.

The wife reports someone in the house, goes on to specifically tell them which window was open and they didn't even do a walk around as our Detective did later on.

The torture of the mentally challenged suspect was a huge part of the movie. The neighbors took part, so in addition to our main Father going to prison, the two neighbors will also be going away.

The Detective is tailing the father to a liquor store where he parks and starts walking away from his truck. The DETECTIVE sits in his car as a dump truck comes from behind and starts BEEPING at him to move. The car is in the street.  The DETECTIVE cannot figure out to simply drive a a bit to allow the truck to go where he needs to?????  Instead he sits there and mutters"go around" to himself and allows the truck to beep a few more times bringing attention to himself. LOL.

After the first day the suspect is taken into custody, there is media outside the police station and a vigil being held at one of the children's houses, but seemingly NOT at Anna's house???  Huh?  Despite there being initial media attention, within a DAY they al disappear so that Hugh Jackman can go stalk the suspect in peace. NONE of the residents in the town ever engage our characters. Despite having just had a VIGIL outside with a dozen plus people another suspect can get into not one, but BOTH of the kidnapped girl's homes!  Wow.  One would think after a kidnapping, a town would be totally on edge and report the SLIGHTEST suspicious thing right away.

One little girl gets away, but nobody asks her where her friend is or what the suspect looks like...they let her take a nap in the hospital?!?!?  Wow!

I could probably come up with a dozen more common sense errors. All the errors took me out of the connection with the characters.  It was like a cartoon to me where anything could and would happen.

Despite getting shot IN THE HEAD our detective thinks it's a good idea to drive the little girl to the ER, full speed, in the snow. Um...AMBULANCE ANYONE?

I mean, the initial suspect disappears, the detective knows the father is doing SOMETHING for long periods of time, but doesn't check other properties of the Father which would show the broken down house where he's keeping the suspect???

No other family members come to visit either family during their major crisis.

How major stars ever got attached to this is beyond me. This is an *incredibly* dumbed down drama.  I'm sad I paid 3.99 for this movie. :-(
It was ridiculously hard to follow right up to the point where it was ridiculously predictable. (About half way through).
Special performances by Hugh Jackman and Jake Gyllenhal.  Subject matter is not appreciated by all. Exciting all the way to the end.
Really, the performances in this all around are convincing and just incredible, I'm surprised I didn't hear more about it when it came out.

I know I would take the same actions given what I heard in the parking lot.
What would you do?
This movie is slightly long winded but is a good thriller. The acting is pretty good by the two main characters and the story is deceptive (in a good way).

Unexpected Dramatically Delightful
Want see it coming. Will love it. Spooky how right and wrong pull at your mind.  Watch it.
Tense movie, solid performances by all actors, but at times felt a bit too slow. Interesting twists and turns throughout.
Good movie. Cant figure out why I don't remember it in theatres or even in Redbox. Worth watching, suspenseful and intense
Great acting. Oscar nom worthy by Jackman and Gyllenhall. Story line very intense and real.  This movie is rivoting and smart.

I hated this movie after wanting to like it. The storyline is not clear, there are numerous loose ends and the premise (which I won't mention because it would spoil the plot for others) very weak. Hated the acting, the scenery and the resolution. There are countless similar films from years ago that are much better (in the same category): the Pledge, Alphabet Killer and others. Don't waste 3 hours of your life on this bore.
Great movie! I usually fall asleep when watching late movies, but this one totally held my attention!!! Great actors to boot!
Not as good as I had hoped for save your money this movie is slow and no real action ehhh

The movie was great - simply great. I hated the fact that I was completely wrong about the entire thing and at times the story would twist you like a Chinese gymnast. Very entertaining film, a real nail biter.

Hugh and Jake did a great job, and that young man Paul Dano, is an amazing talent.  Intense and draws you in.  I did think they drew out the ending a little bit too much, but overall, a great piece of film-making.  Kudos to the director, and Hugh had an especially powerful performance.  Exceptional.
The acting was good and the storyline was good.  It kept us interested.  It may have gone on a little too long, though.
This movie kept us all guessing as to what was going to happen . Good actors and made you think what does actually haplen out there in the world.
AGAIN, HUGH JACKMAN IS AT HIS BEST.  THIS IS A VERY GOOD NAIL BITING, FULL OF DRAMA MOVIE, AND I WOULD WATCH IT OVER AND OVER.  IT IS A GREAT MOVIE, A THRILLER, WITH A VERY GREAT ENDING.

This movie kept me on edge the whole time with out any action scenes.  Outwardly this movie seems a bit slow paced but really if you pay attention,  the movie is on the edge the whole time. I really reccomend putting the phone away,  close the laptop,  do away with any distractions because if you only half pay attention you are missing the underlying creepiness of this movie.
Powerful acting by all, well executed story, dark clues buried throughout the movie,  the ending is a little too convenient.
This was a fantastic movie and worth the money. I could have saved a few dollars by renting from redbox but I couldn't wait to watch it!

I was looking forward to the movie based on the normal quality of the work by such actors as Jackman but....

I assume that the director was adhering to the written screenplay but that was actually the poor choice in the movie's rendition.

Normally, if there can ever be a "normality" associated with such a terrible event as a child abduction, the decent into the hell of panic, frustration and hate/revenge by the parents (Jackman, et. al.), would help to raise the clarity of the characters and their own failings and foibles. Not so in this case. Additionally, the characterization of the detective does not "normally" exacerbate the spiraling of the parents.

In this case, the writer decided to provide the audience with what I would characterize as "snippets" rather than a cohesive flow. These "snippets" may help pander to the grisliness of the "reflective abduction and torture" of the supposed child abductor and help to hold the audience in a tension centered around the choices we might make between what is right and wrong. However, it was at this point that the movie became tedious because once the characters were in this horrific dilemma the piece goes from "searching" to "revenge" to "sadism" in quick order.

Fortunately for writers in hollywood, they can merely construct a way out of the contrived dilemma by making the decision to wreak revenge, the actual right/wrong/right decision flow. This construct then leaves the movie with some needed way to reflect the ultimate karma on Jackman's character by placing him in a "hole" - literally! Moreover, the audience is then left hanging at the end of the movie with the detective looking wistfully into the night wondering why he is hearing a whistle at which time the screen goes to final credits.

Way too tedious (centering on the questions of right and wrong), and way too glib (centering on the "superman" capabilities of the abductors and the "foolishness/bumbling" of the everyman parents and detective). The movie production values cast by the dreariness of the Pennsylvania winter-scape does place a "nice" pall on the movie throughout, by-the-way. Having spent many a winter in Pennsylvania I can attest to the dreariness!

Child abductions will always be horrific and affected parents will always attempt anything they can in order to find their children but to make them "mock" revengers does a disservice to the real men and women who attempt to rectify real child abduction situations, in my opinion.

I finished the movie wondering why Jackman and the rest of the cast allowed themselves to be associated with the screenplay but I suppose money does the talking.

This movie kept you on the edge of your seat.  It was suspenseful.  The acting was good.  The ending was terrific for some and disappointing to others.  It had a very unusual ending.  The violence was a little disturbing though.
S***ty ending.  Long drawn out surprise that wasn't that surprising.  Nothing on M. Knight.  I wouldnt ever watch it again.

WOW is all I can say.  I'm a big suspense thriller kind of chick...No chick flicks here.  This had me on my seat, and you will be blown away.  It goes a little slow from time to time, but I don't think you will be unhappy with watching it.  Good luck and enjoy.
Kept me guessing the whole time, LOVED IT! Worth the rental! Would watch it twice. Very good movie, would recommend it
The movie was sad, but shows you what a parent will do for their kids. I also think it is great for our kids to watch this to show them they must never ever trust strangers.
I hated the ending!!!  Plus some scenes they were talking so low I could barely hear them.  Something was missing
This story is Slow and Scary with many twist and turns. Long drawn out movie that is ok but not great
story is okay and the twists are as well, if you have a child or little brother/sister you will watch them a lot better. love artistic endings?
Good acting and good action. It has some twists and turns that keep you guessing. Good thriller for a Saturday night.

Almost had a heart attack watching this movie. I can usually guess what's going to happen next but this just kept on pulling the rug out from under me. WOW! The last couple of scenes had me literally screaming(and hands shaking) at the tv LOL. I need a drink after watching that.. yikes. Can't praise this enough. Hugh and Jake's best acting work by a country mile. In a just world this would win a bunch of oscars.... I thought Gravity was intense but that was Wallace and Gromit comared to this. SEE THIS NOW!

Prisoners is a movie about Keller Dover's (Hugh Jackman) daughter and her friend go missing, he decides to take matters into his own hands as the police pursue multiple leads and the pressure mounts.

I actually didn't know what to expect about this movie as I hadn't seen the trailer or knew much about the movie at the time I rented but I did like the actors involved and decided to give this a shot.  And I for sure wasn't disappointed, this movie is an intense thriller that holds you by your heart the whole way through and throws in a morality play as part of the well though out plot and story.  Hugh Jackman does an excellent job at playing the distraught father who goes to all extremes to find his daughter.  My only criticisms about the movie is that it clocks a little long at over 2 hours and 32 minutes and the beginning is a bit slow.  However, the movie builds to an intensity and gives you many twists and turns that you forget that it is that long and started a bit slowly.  The ending also gives a bit of a twist that like the movie's title leaves everyone involved prisoners in one way or another.

An excellent movie that is worth watching, especially if you are a parent.
We ordered our movie in HD, but could not believe the poor quality. Movie was great. That is the only reason we continued watching it. Will not purchase another movie to watch through Amazon.
I love these 2 actors. They work really well together, I would love to see them do more.  The movie did not drag. Kept me wondering who was the bad guy all the way to the end.
Excellent dialog. Realistic performances. Brings to life the actions a parent would take to save the life of their children.
What would you do if your child was missing or kidnapped? Prisoners is a dark look into a parent's desperate attempt to find their missing children. Wonderful acting and horrifying scenes.

This movie really keeps you on edge! If you're into movies like se7en, murder by numbers, or any of the silence of the lambs movies then you will love it. It carries that dark sided thrill ride we didn't expect!
I enjoyed the DVD Prisoners very much. It kept you on the edge of your seat most of the time. I'm a fan of Hugh Jackman, and I think he did an excellant in this movie. Thank you.

I don't normally do reviews, but this was an excellent film.  I highly recommend anyone thinking of renting or buying this one to do so.  It is definitely worth it.  There are some really violent scenes, but as a parent, I think I'd go as far as that to get mine back.  Don't go by my review though ... watch for yourself.  Great movie.
Great performances with good twists and turns in the story line.  I would def recommended it to anyone that likes movies.

The acting was pretty darn good, I could see how the abduction of the girls impacts each family member in different ways. Hugh's performance seemed extreme but possible in a father who loses his youngest daughter. The other father was appalled at the actions taken by Hugh's character, but went along with it anyway, just in case. It made me feel sorry for the suspect.
The mother's were different in their reactions too. One pulls away from all life interaction, and the other tries to help find the girls.
I saw this twice and it was different for me the second time, knowing what to look for and the why of the whole thing. Strange.
I loved this movie the acting was great the story line was believable I cried got angry and yelled at the TV like a crazy woman but who didn't.
Excellent acting, very beliavable plot, and the twists are unpredictable but believable (unlike other movies where the twist is ridiculous and too fabricated/manipulated)
I liked it because it was not predictable. Kept us guessing all the way. We discussed it for a couple of days after.

Loved this movie, left me wanting to watch more!!!  LOVED< LOVED< LOVED
Such a great story and very suspenseful!!  Highly recommended to watch

This movie is one of the best that came out last year, very intense on the edge of your seat with outstanding acting all around.  A situation that would be every parents nightmare without showing graphic violence toward the children in this movie but centering more on how it affects each individual and what it brings out in different people.  One of the best movies I have seen in a long time!

This movie easily could have achieved a five star rating.
(SPOILER WARNING)

The problems I had with the plot is as follows:
1) the mysterious pervert that the detective chased around was a red herring and was never fully tied to the lot or properly explained.
2) The main character demonstrated a flaw in character which is an error in scripting IMO.  He knew the mother was involved and he let the mother best him when he showed up at the jones house at the end?  Doesn't seem true to the character who was presented as well prepared and hyper vigilant giving the events.

Other than that the movie was one of the best I've seen in a while.

I was not expecting much and did not really plan to watch the movie, but was very pleasantly surprised. Excellent story, good acting, really make you feel for the people, challenges your morals and limits. Good twist at the end. I was on the edge of my seat. Worth the time and money!
The movie was more than I expected. The ending was not what I thought it was going to be but I understand the reason for it's ending. I loved the movie and kept me interested the whole way through!!
Watch the trailer, and you've seen enough.  This movie has no redeeming value.  The cast is good, I just expected a much better film.

Prisoners is less the cat and mouse kind of crime thriller but more a story about how the crime affects the people involved. Most movies kind of clumsily lead you down a path, believing one person or another was guilty, but I can genuinely say that I had no idea who kidnapped the girls and was surprised by their identity once revealed. The most riveting aspect of the film is what helplessness and grief does to Hugh Jackman's character.

I loved this movie, it had very good acting, twist and turns.  I think the ending leaves you wanting more.  It was leading and I can figure out what happen, but it seems like it could use a little more closure.  Other than that, one of the best I have seen in a while.

I was on the edge of my seat during this movie...it had me wondering when, who, what, why! Wow...I recommend you watch it during a rainy day at home, it sets the mood. All the characters played their parts very well...Hugh Jackman did better in this than Wolverine...

Some parts of the story bugged me. Other parts disturbed me. Others scared me. This movie is not the typical thriller. But it will hold your attention. If you like movies that aren't cookie cutter, and you don't mind seeing a deer being shot for food, you'll like this movie.

I am very hard to please when it comes down to movies. I watched it without my oldest son and then he asked "how was the movie?" I simply said it was good... And he was like whaaat!?, did you actually just said that? So would I recommend it? Of course!!!  Didn't even feel the 2 1/2hrs.... I could say more about the movie but I don't want to give it up.....
Would of given less stars but Hugh Jackmans performance was great. The movie dragged on and never kept me thinking "what's next"?
Everything a a father would do for his kidnapped daughter packed in an awesome thriller.  Good acting, just the right pace... absolutely recommendable, until the very last second.
This movie keeps you on the edge of your seat from beginning to end . Didn't like how it left the ending open for another movie though.

This is the second HD movie that I have rented thorugh Amazon and each time I have had to call them to fix the sound. So, I guess you could say that Prisoners was good, but Amazon "HD" streaming is bad. On top of that the people who you call for help don't always know what they are doing. The first time I called, no problem. The second time, for this movie, I think I could have gotten the job if I applied wiht the amount of knowledge this person didn't display when trouble shooting the problem. Stick to regular movies until Amazon can fix their HD problem.
Much better than I expected.  The story is one that we have seen before but this is really different.  Rent it.

No spoiler review:

Good acting by most of the cast.  The lead detective does a great job. The film is well directed. There is nothing extraneous in the film to fill voids of time. There was not much money spent on building sets, but the story line requires middle class neighborhoods, houses, dens, bedrooms, kitchens. So much so, that it is a relief when action takes place outside.

It is a mystery with a lot of tension and suspense; and the clues are there if you can remember them when things begin to come together. It has a fair amount of action, and no gratuitous gore.

Biggest negatives: The premise is a bit far fetched and the reaction to tragedy is off the wall; not necessarily unusual in films of this genre.
This movie keeps you guessing all the way through to the end with a surprise twist. Awesome plot line and wonderful acting.

This movie was incredible!!  It kept you guessing, and on the edge of your seat!  I know of a lot of people who don't want to see it (my niece being one, because she's a new mom, and her daughter also named "Anna."  So I don't blame her in the least).  But I loved everything about this movie.  Hugh's performance was gripping, heart wrenching, powerful, and very believable!  I loved the scene with him, and "Loki" in the car.  You can feel Hugh's rage when he starts yelling and pounding on the dashboard.  That alone, should win him an Oscar.

Some people described this as grim. I don't know how that's the case. It is, though, very intense. I don't remember having as an intense feeling like this other than when I first watched Silence Of The Lambs. You know how ever DVD case has words in quotes on their movies to describe them, like "Thrilling", "Riveting", "Edge-Of-Your-Seat" and they turn out to be sub par at best? Well this is actually all those things. I felt like I had just been on a ride when I was done. Jake Gyllenhal was so good I can't even explain. Hugh Jackman was effective as the insane father. He often seems miscast (I;m thinking specifically of Wolverine), but he always steps up to the plate and delivers. Everyone is good and I realized believeability is what's missing in most suspense dramas that are made in The States. I watch a lot of British crime drama and they really have it right. This is a movie so it doesn't have as long to develop the characters, so it take you right into it very soon. You learn who they are by how they react to this horrific thing that's happened.

Hugh Jackman and Jake Gyllenhaal star in this 2013 thriller.
A man seeks justice to find 2 abducted girls while a detective
tries solving the case.  This is a good, dramatic thriller and
Jackman & Gyllenhaal are great in it. This set has nice
picture and sound plus 2 neat featurettes. I recommend
this.

This falls into the genre of "mysteries/crimes" which no one could foresee.  There is no actual lead-up to the actual perpetrators of the crime, so you just follow along.  The story is poorly conceived and written, and far too long to be engaging.  Two terrible kidnappings occur, but you (as the audience) have zero chance of targeting a suspect -- and I think that is the height of shoddy workmanship.  If the film had some other element working for it, one might overlook the extremely boring aspects.  If you want to find an entertaining kidnapping movie, try "Ransom" or "Man on Fire."  Both of these films make this "effort" stand out as a complete wreck.
This is such a good movie.  It kept me on the edge of my seat...and a great ending.  I highly recommend this one. It is full of suspense and a very believable story line.  Great entertainment!,,

The movie is an alright story.  Starts out pretty slow and is pretty predicatable.  If your not good at figuring out movies this will be an awe inspired film.  If your an avid movie critic you can predict the story within the first 30 minutes of the film

Great acting,solid suspense thriller, and raised some interesting moral questions and commentary on the effectiveness of certain interrogation methods. Felt like it could have gone deeper  but obviously limited by run time. Not sure if it was adapted from a novel but I could imagine it being a great read with the ability to further explore a few things.
Yeah this ones alright. Don't think it's as good as some of these reviewers, nor as bad as some. Give it a one time watch... No replay value

Scary premise of a story but fantastic acting and greatly made movie. Picture & audio quality wasn't perfect but good most of the time.

The first hour is full of hope...that something sensible might happen in the second hour.  And nothing happens.  Action, yes, good acting, up to a point.  But sense?...totally absent.  Little girls abducted in the midst of a family crowd at a holiday time?  Psychotic fathers jumping on the first suspect to torture him into confession? Friends with a missing daughter unable to make any moral decision of an sort?  Crazed young men hiding their snakes in locked (and probably oxygenless) crates?  Gun molls of a motherly type getting rid of the opposition (whatever that is supposed to be)?

This movie, despite its stellar cast, all of whom act as well as they have been trained (and, in most of their cases, that has been quite adequate, is fussy, busy, insensitive, and boring.

this movie did have me on the edge on my seat like can someone just confuse. Suspenseful and superb acting. The movie made you feel as if you were part of those families as we have all had the same nightmare.
Well rounded great movie!! Keeps you on the edge of your seat!! Highly recommended for a someone looking for a great movie!

Academy award performances by both male leads.  All stops were pulled!

This is a tremendously difficult movie to watch. It's also one of the best thrillers I've seen in a long time. It's nearly impossible to take your eyes off the screen once it starts. You may think you know what's coming but with all it's twists and turns it will surprise you,  scare you, and make you want to believe in the impossible even more than you originally thought it could.  When seeing this superlatively well acted movie, each member of the entire cast makes it so believable it's was difficult to separate the actors from the parts they played. What they achieved in this powerful film was that good.  A deeply affecting film which has remained with me in ways I never expected after I'd seen it.

This movie kept me guessing.  There were so many twists and turns.  I was really interested the whole time!  Excellent film!

We never got close to guessing the ending.

And, it does even better than Zero Dark Thirty at addressing torture as a means of getting information a character needs to save innocent life.

The layers of emotion in this movie are unbelievable. It evokes a fear that no one would ever want to feel, and it forces you to sympathize with characters you never thought you would. Top notch performances from Jackman and Gyllenhaal. I would highly recommend this movie.

If you like Fritz Lang and wish for his spirit in current filmmaking, look no further.  This film is extremely Langian, from the unsavory heroes who only find their own smallness and helplessness, not their redemption, to the plot twists that are so jaw-droppingly unbelievable they can only exist as material evidence of a fatalism that is beyond capricious.  Also, let's not forget the "mob mentality" a la Fury.  This is a film that sets out to be about very disturbing things and manages to be genuinely disturbing, and yet so fascinating that you feel almost uplifted by the absolute clarity of vision.  What I like best are the things that are never explained -- the strange, almost Night of the Hunter-like tattoos that the Gyllenhaal character wears, or the whereabouts of certain missing characters.  In this film everyone's a missing person until proven otherwise.

I TOTALLY did not see THAT ending coming !!! WOW~ Both Jackman and Gyllenhall play outstanding roles in this suspenseful thriller. You see the torment Jackman as the Father is going through, how he struggles to believe anything is permissible, no matter how heinous, as long as he gets the information he is hell-bent on getting. I love plot twists and this one has a doozy ! Enjoy, my fellow cinematophiles~ :)

With the cast crew it has, it seems ridiculous because this is an all time underrated movie.

This story line, about the abduction of two young girls from anywhere USA suburbia, is disturbing, the nightmare of any parent realized.  Hugh Jackman is great as the desperate father searching for his children, and the ending is a twister.  If you are a fan of gripping thrillers, this is a great movie to watch.
So thrilling on the edge of your seat! Jake Gyllenhaal place such a convincing role. Great acting. Very convincing. Awesome.

was a realy good movie lots of unepected twist to it. Not a family movie adult only but was a gret intense movie

In many movies you can see the ending coming from the first few minutes.  This movie was not one of them.  The suspense remained for the whole movie and both Hugh Jackman and Jake Gyllenhaal gave good performances.
The movie is a dark drama.  Do not see it if you are not in a strong mindset.  Also, definitely do not see it with children, as it is not a movie for young children to watch.
I am sorry I watched this film. Not a commentary on the film-making, but the subject matter; how the abduction of his daughter sucked all humanity from her father.

Sacrifice is a common theme in Prisoners from the opening scene in the forest Keller Dover (Hugh Jackman) recites a prayer while his son Ralph Dover (Dylan Minnette) kills his first deer to the climax where the kidnapper explains that god is the reason why he or she is doing what they are doing and the reasoning behind all the violence her or she has committed, and it both benefits and hurts Prisoners making it a gripping yet an overly long and flawed mystery thriller.

As with any good mystery thriller there has to be tension to keep the viewer guessing what will happen next, and suspense as to keep the viewer guessing as whom the murderer is, but first we must take a step back. Keller Dover is down on his luck carpenter whom is struggling, but still able to provide for his family. Keller a deeply spiritual man and his family head to his friend Franklin Birch (Terrence Howard) home for Thanksgiving. The two families eat, drink and have fun until their daughters Anna Dover (Erin Gerasimovich) and Joy Birch (Kyla Drew Simmons) head off on their own, and never return to the Birch's home. With the tension rising as the parents call the police and search the neighborhood for the strange RV Ralph had spotted earlier, and this is where Detective Loki (Jake Gyllenhaal) makes his appearance when he gets the call about the RV arresting Alex Jones (Paul Dano).

The tension and suspense really ratchets up in Prisoners from this point on as Loki and the CSI's find no evidence that Alex took the two girls, and is forced to let Alex go free yet Keller after a confrontation with Alex is sure the man knows where his daughter is and takes matters into his own hand. Director Denis Villeneuve and writer Aaron Guzikowski do a good job keeping up the drama and suspense as they keep hinting that Alex might be the kidnapper yet at the same time throwing in more suspects along the way to keep the viewer guessing until close to the end of the film. Besides the theme of sacrifice another theme Villeneuve and Guzikowski throw in a moral one as well, and try to get the viewer to understand Keller's decisions he has made like how far would you go to find your daughter, what sacrifices would you make to find your daughter, and for the majority of the film director Villeneuve and writer Guzikowiski succeed in doing so.

While I really enjoyed Prisoners I had some issues with the story, and the characters as well with the biggest issue being the climax of the film. You wanted to see if the parents were worth of god's love? I know I can't read the minds of serial killers and kidnappers, but the reasoning just didn't match the tone of the film, and where the story was headed. I expected a better thought out payoff than the one I got in Prisoners. Along with the reasoning behind the kidnapping leads to another issue I had with the final act of Prisoners in that the kidnapper could have easily gotten away with it if he or she had just answered the door for Loki. They had plenty of time to hide the evidence, and Loki had no reason or a warrant to search the home. That scene just took me out of what was supposed to be a tension filled scene. Finally there is the scene with Grace Dover (Maria Bello) and detective Loki where she explains that everything her husband did was justified and without him doing what he did Loki wouldn't have found their daughter, which is just crap. I can't believe the writers trying to justify what Keller did forced the character Grace to say that, and I know she's Keller's wife, but Grace can't honestly believe that even if she won't voice it out loud. It was simply laughable moment, because what Keller did was all for nothing. Nothing he did helped find his daughter in fact he was hindering the investigation as Loki had to look into the disappearance of Alex taking time away from searching for the missing children. Director Villeneuve and writer Guzikowiski nearly let everything they achieved in Prisoners fall apart in the final act with plot holes, poorly written dialogue, and out of character decisions made by certain characters. The other problem I had with the Prisoners was the length of the film. The film I watched didn't justify a length of two hours and a half. With some smart editing the film could have been cut down to around two hours and fifteen minutes, and I believe those cuts would have added to the tension and suspense of the film.

While the final act of Prisoners faltered the performances by the actors didn't. Hugh Jackman gives his best performance since the Prestige if not his career as Keller. The emotion Jackman gives to Keller brings to life the character and the decisions he has made, and the price Keller has paid making theme. Jake Gyllenhaal also gives an outstanding performance as Detective Loki who has chosen the job over having a family. Gyllenhaal really should stay away from the blockbuster films like Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time and the Day After Tomorrow, because Gyllenhall is a far better actor in dramatic roles than action roles as he has proven in Donnie Darko, End of Watch, and Brokeback Mountain. Maria Bello doesn't have much to do in Prisoners as the distraught Grace Dover, but she gives a believable performance as a mother who has lost her daughter cutting herself off from the outside world. Like Mario Bello, Terrence Howard doesn't have much to do in his role as Franklin Birch as he is relegated to Keller's accomplice, but the experienced actor Howard gives his all in the role displaying the conflicting emotions when is morality is tested as he helps Keller in his quest to find their daughters.

If not for the faulty final act, and climax Prisoners would go down as one of the great mystery thrillers like Memento, The Silence of the Lambs, and L.A. Confidential, but even with its flaws Prisoners is a riveting engrossing thriller with a quality moral story that will keep you guessing nearly to the end, outstanding performances by Hugh Jackman, Jake Gyllenhaal, and the rest of the cast that helps to turn Prisoners into enthralling, nerve-racking and thoughtful thriller, and one of the better films of the year.

The kidnap/mystery story (Jake Gyllenhall's part of the story) was clever but no better than any old Law&Order episode.  What made this movie special was the father's (Hugh Jackman's) trauma.  Here's this guy -- a strong man barely making a living for his family -- whose daughter is kidnapped.  He's supposed to leave it in the hands of the more competent professionals, but he just can't.  The vagaries of the law and the mixed cultural expectations upon him push him take the law into his own hands.  Of course, we've seen THAT story too, but this isn't the vigilante blazing his way through the bad guys; he's an intelligent man, but untrained and lacking the resources he needs to find his daughter, stumbling through every father's nightmare.  Really good stuff.

This struck me as an attempt to be a Coen brothers film that fell way short of the mark. The characters are largely two-dimensional and undeveloped. The long run time exceeds the story and is squandered upon dwelling on the maudlin.

Gyllenhaal plays a police detective investigating the disappearance of two young girls. You learn very little about him, except that he's somewhat oblivious to clues. He has a stereotype relationship with his stereotype harried boss.

Of the two sets of parents, one father receives a dollup of character development. The other three are relegated to props. The plot does contain some twists but suffers from gaps and omissions.

The actors do a pretty good job with what they're given to work with. But, that isn't much and the weaknesses become more strident as the movie plods through its excessive length.

First and foremost the writing was top notch and the director knew exactly how to film it.

This is a actor who deserved an Oscar a long time ago and if he doesn't even get a "nod" for this film, well he may never win an Oscar. As for the rest of the cast everyone else was also in the top of their game and should be recognized for it. If you are into mystery/thrillers this film is for you, it is an intense ride and is worth multiple viewings if nothing else to watch the amazing performances/cinematography.

4.5/5  Stars.

The cinematography alone would have made me give it a high rating, because it sets the bleak tone and the cold, raw atmosphere of the film so beautifully. The script was suspenseful [ I actually had to close my eyes during some frightening parts] and had some nice twists and turns.

Jake Gyllenhaal's performance as the policeman, Loki,  was wonderful. His background was just hinted at, a youth spent at a boys' home, but his lack of affect, impenetrable solitude and street tattoos spoke volumes. Viola Davis, Terrence Howard and Maria Bello were fine though a bit underutilized in smaller roles, and Paul Dano was credible as the suspect in a Thanksgiving kidnapping.

However, the character played by Hugh Jackman was so cliched and over the top, that for me, the movie was marred by it [and  I am  a Northern urban dweller, neither Christian nor right wing].  One the one hand, I'm happy the otherwise talented screenwriter broke through to the big time and is now living his dream, on the other, his depiction of  a ' redneck ' father who becomes a vigilante and takes justice into his own hands is stereotypically New York/ Hollywoodish : a snarling, deer hunting survivalist upholder of the second amendment, who is drunk, violent and prays before committing heinous acts.

The motivation for the latter day gun toting Bloody Mama - waging a war on God to make parents lose their faith is fairly absurd [ generally people who kidnap and kill children have far more heinous motivations]  and the dog torturing intellectually disabled suspect is named Alex Jones, like the conspiracy mongering talk show host,  which should give you a clue where the scriptwriter is coming from.

Consequently, the movie, which was set up as a moral examination of the events depicted, falls short of that goal and becomes more of a twisty -turn scare fest.  Personally, I preferred The Changeling and Gone Baby Gone which are far more penetrating and chilling.
I will not say much except that I am picky about movies.  This movie is mysterious in many ways and it captivated me.  It is quite long and I didn't mind that at all.  The acting is superb.

This is one of the most moving and powerful films I have seen in a long time. This film grabbed me by the throat and never let go. This is  movie making at it's most dramatic and breathtaking. Like films of the past with a similar style and story such as Zodiac and Seven, it's the stuff legends are made of. At the time I am writing this, the Oscar contenders have not yet been announced. That being said, it would be a miracle if this film is not nominated for numerous Oscars and does not win. everything about this movie is top notch, the direction is superb, the pace is electrifying, the music is foreboding and haunting. And most of all the acting is incredible. Hugh Jackman gives a performance that has to be seen to be believed. I predict he will be nominated for best actor and likely will win the Oscar. Performances this intense, believable and this raw and lifelike are rare in cinema. This is a performance of a lifetime. I'm simply astonished at Jackman's performance. And Terrence Howard also turns in what I think is the best performance of his career. I have never much cared for him all that much until now. In fact I always find him rather annoying. I don't know why. But I have a refreshed opinion of Howard after seeing this movie. His performance here is brilliant. It's understated and to his credit it is absolutely beautiful acting. One of the best supporting performances I have ever seen. This movie never goes where you expect and never ends up where you think it will. The mood of the film is grim and haunting. It never let go of me and sucked me in until the very end. It's been awhile since I have been this enthralled with any movie no matter what the genre. Prisoners is a fine example of edge of your seat master film making, and one of spine tingling suspense. If it doesn't make the list of best picture contenders this year it would certainly be a crime. This is one fantastic ride, made with passion and real skill. Not to be missed.
Rivoting & thought provoking, every parents worst nightmare - this movie is filled with twists and turns and leaves you thinking and talking about for a long time after watching .

This is a dark twisted movie. The trailer is slightly misleading though, only slightly. It's not as much about the kidnapping as it is about a man's morals and values and how much he is willing to abandon those morals and values in order to find the most precious thing in his life, his child. Everyone in the cast especially Hugh Jackman, Jake Gyllenhal, and Terrence Howard did a fantastic job. I am also eager to see more of the actor who played the son, Dylan Minnette. He was great in this role as well as in 'Awake' with Jason Isaacs. That kid has a bright future. The only reason it's not 5 stars is the ending. Those type of endings have their place but with this movie it just doesn't fit.

I liked this movie butit went on way too long. Tightening up the convoluted plot and shortening the movie by about thirty minutes would have made it a suspenseful story. Hugh Jackman and Jake Gyllenhaal are just incredible actors. I can't imagine how they must have felt everyday after filming. Alex Jones, played by Paul Dano, is a character I will NEVER forget. I wish I could. I won't watch it again. It affected me like the movie "In the Bedroom." The story is well done but I don't need to think about these kinds of real life situations. My life is real enough, thank you very much!

And, inexplicably, the movie stops just before the end of the story is told, leaving the viewer to guess as to what may have happened. But it wasn't a Jason Bourne type of question mark at the end, it was more of a "what the hell?" type question mark. A complete waste of time.

It was graphic and horrible. It's my opinion that not one of the characters acted within character. The mothers didn't respond like any mother I know would. The fathers started out acting like they should but quickly went nuts. The cop did so many unorthodox things, completely out of character for any cop I know. I could only watch the first hour before I had to turn it off because of the torture aspects that, at least to me, were leading no where. I don't guess I can ask for a refund for a truly horrible movie... It's my responsibility to read the reviews first. I hated this movie. I probably won't watch another movie for a long time based on the horror of having seen 1/3 of this one.

I eventually finished the movie and it does have a surprise twist in the end. Personally I think movies like that should have a warning because I would never watch them.  I need a conclusion to a movie after all that time vested into watching it.

Prisoners is likely one of those films that you'll want to watch more than once.  The ending took me completely by surprise, and before we find out who the Big Bad is, there are a number of red herrings thrown in our path.  On my second viewing, I was happy to see that the ending held up, and the clues, which I'd managed to overlook, were there all along.

Prisoners is a dark story that covers many unpleasant topics: child abduction, pedophilia, and vigilante justice.  When two young girls disappear, the abductor seems clear: the creepy, mute guy, hanging out in a van nearby.  He's quickly captured by the police, but they don't have enough evidence to hold him.  Hugh Jackman, as one of the fathers, decides to take matters into his own hands.  He kidnaps and tortures the suspect, desperate for information.  Terrence Howard and Viola Davis, playing the parents of the other girl, are a bit more conflicted, but they're reluctant to stand in Jackman's way.  Jake Gyllenhall is excellent as the detective who keeps more of an open mind about the potential suspect, even while he remains unaware of Jackman's actions.

A lot of people watching this film may wonder if they'd go to the same extremes as Jackman.  If he's right in his assumptions about the suspect, it may be hard to fault him.  But if he's wrong, his actions are monstrous.
Suppenful and smart film. It keeps you guessing to the end. Great performance by all actors and the plot was real.

I could not at first put my finger on why this movie didn't fly with me, until later, when I realized it had two leading men and could not decide who was the top gun.  The movie is about two families celebrating Thanksgiving who suddenly realize their little girls are gone.  An older son had seen them playing near an old RV, with someone in it, earlier in the evening.  The father of one girl is convinced the damaged mental young man whom the police find driving the RV, is the culprit, even though the police, including the lead detective, who has never not solved a case, dismiss the notion and release him.  The lead detective and the one volatile violent father are the "leading men", given about equal time.  The problem I see with the movie is that the audience is quickly given information that the father is correct in believing the young man with the RV is involved.  I spent the whole movie cursing at the lead detective, who has to go all over and around and finally back to the original RV guy and his mother.  The father takes drastic and violent measures, kidnapping and torturing the RV man, in grotesque manners, to try to get him to talk.  The movie is far too disjointed for me to enjoy.  The plot beneath however is relatively simplistic.  I gave it three stars to be nice.  It deserves only two.
What a great movie! It was worth every penny I paid for it! I wanted watch it again right after seeing it!

No one would be so foolish or careless.  Nor would things tidy up like they did at the end.  I can see why the actors signed up for this movie, the potential is so great; but the execution was just awful.
Although some of the images are disturbing, PRISONERS is one of the best thrillers I've seen in some time.  I would rank it alongside of MYSTIC RIVER, SEVEN and ZODIAC.

That's the ending? What happened? DUMB!!!!

Denis Villeneuves Prisoners is way better than it looks in the trailer. The trailer seems to give away all the secrets of the film upfront; it portrays the film as lacking depth, but in reality, its just the trailer that misleads. There is much more to Prisoners than one may anticipate.

The film stars Hugh Jackman (surprise, surprise) as Keller Dover. Jackman is having an over-exposure problem at this moment in his career. As the actor seems to appear in every other film released these days, this creates questions that shouldnt exist like, What is the Wolverine doing in this movie Prisoners? Nonetheless Jackman delivers a solid, if not dimensional performance. His energy keeps the movie constantly driving forward.

The film opens with two working class families getting together to celebrate Thanksgiving. Festivities abound, but while the responsible adults of the film have their attentions focused elsewhere, their two little girls run outside to play, unchaperoned. By the time the girls absence is noticed, its too late. The girls are gone. They have been taken. The major conflict of the film then is how to get the girls back alive.

This job falls on Detective Loki, (Jake Gyllenhaal) but when Loki fails to produce results quickly enough, Keller Dover decides to take the search for the girls, and for civil justice, into his own hands. Performance-wise, Gyllenhaal as Loki is the highlight of the film. He maintains a subtle, calm composure, which contrasts Kellers (Jackmans) constant flying-off-the-rails. Loki shows a certain vulnerability while still being able to pull off fast-pace action sequences in an authentic, belivable way. He is very enjoyable to watch.

The actual visual experience of Villeneuves films is very important. His 2010 film Incendies made full use of wide and vast cinematography applied in exotic landscapes. This visual imagery captivated, but all the technique was there to serve the story, the plot developments, the characters. Incendies is a masterfully crafted tragedy and Villeneuves commanding technique is evident too throughout Prisoners.

Like Incendies the filters and tones that are applied to the film, as in the actual visual images on screen, are gloomy and sepia-toned. Theres not a single sunny sky, a warm day, an orderly room. Sets are designed to feel dark and empty, the best scenes use sets that play with space, showing both the abundance of vacant space for some characters, while still emphasizing the feeling of enclosure felt by others. The use of light and dark, order and disorder, space, all things that cradle the actors performances, are created by Villeneuve, expertly.

The suspense of the film continues all the way to the very end as Keller Dovers untamed compulsion to find the missing girls leads to a perfectly executed, nail biter of an ending.

Dumbest movie ever. The characters make no sense and are never developed. The story is lame and the ending is horrible!
This movie was way too long and story development was slow.  Hated the ending.  Wish I could return for refund.

this film is very typical compared to other kidnapping movies. if it were not for the scenes were Hugh Jackman and Terence Howard (fathers of the two missing girls) torture and brutally beat the suspected retarded kid who was the last to see them, it would almost be exactly like a majority of other kidnapping movies.  But surprisingly,  the plot does thicken (as they say) and Jackman continues to shine when he does some investigating on his own and decides to go to the house where the retarded kid lives to talk to the lady that also lives there. He seems unsatisfied after talking to her though and knows she is hiding something and cant be trusted.  He then returns for a second visit to the house, where the plot gives us a surprising twist and Jackman becomes a hostage himself!
the other stand-out performance is given to us by Jake G., who plays the cool tempered ever-persistent detective (who comes equipped with excellent instincts) investigating the case. throughout the film he is annoyed by a fumbling police chief and people who want to tell him how to do his job. he draws us in as he pursues the leads and clues. Frustrated with bad results and no solid leads, WE follow Jake G. to the house where Jackman was last scene and he engages the woman living there in an intense bloody scene where he gets a nasty blow to the head that leaves him loopy and disoriented, he nonetheless forces himself to keep going and finds the missing girl(who has been drugged heavily and is unconscious), bleeding profusely and knocked silly he then picks her up and runs to his patrol and throws her in the back, he knows he has to get her to the the hospital as fast as possible and he races through traffic driving like a madman wiping blood from his eyes the whole way barely holding on to consciousness himself trying to save the little girl!  these scenes are some of the best the movie has to offer, delivering on the suspense, tension, and emotions as mother and little girl are finally reunited. but we are left wandering what happened to Jackman who is now missing.  we follow the freshly bandaged up Jake G. whose instincts are  in high gear now as he begins searching for the missing father and we return (yet again) to the house where Jackman was last seen.  he looks around for a while and we hear the sound of a whistle (which was left by his daughter when she was a captive in the same hole) and then.....nothing...that's it!
this ending is obvious, we know he is going to find the missing Jackman, but the suspense is not comparable to the other scenes in the movie as we are left hanging!  the movie for the most part is great, but the ending is a dud, and it leaves you disappointed wanting something more!

Prisoners is a 2013 thriller directed by the gifted Denis Villeneuve. The films cast includes Hugh Jackman, Jake Gyllenhaal, Viola Davis, Maria Bello, Terrence Howard, Melissa Leo, and Paul Dano.  Powered by an unusually rich, twisty script by Aaron Guzikowski (Contraband) and career-best performances from Jackman and Gyllenhaal.  This is the tale of two Pennsylvania families searching for their kidnapped daughters.  The plot focuses on the abduction of two young girls in Pennsylvania and the search to find them.  But the abduction is only the beginning of the movie.  The movie is shot beautifully and adds to the almost unbearable tension for two-and-a-half hours of the screen time.  The movie had me standing for whole second half.  This movie is the kind of adult drama of the sort Hollywood almost never makes anymore.  I enjoyed this movie and would definitely recommend it.

Thank you for reading my review.
Great movie with an odd ending! The story line was suspenseful and it took time to develop.  Hugh J was good.

This movie should make every parent aware of the actual dangers out there and to keep a closer eye on their children. Kids go missing every day in this country and around the world. Do not get complacent in your everyday lives and think for even one minute that this sort of thing can't happen to your family.

The screenplay was well written, the direction and cinematography were excellent, and the acting was superb. I like it when a movie creates tension and suspense through the storytelling, rather than laying blatant props, flashback scenes, or forced dialogue to try and lead the audience somewhere else because the screenplay was poorly written or executed.

I don't recommend this for kids - even with supervision - because it challenges our moral compass in a way that only an adult might fully understand.

Desperation, drive, an unstoppable need to restore what's ours...Great performances by everyone - especially Hugh Jackman who spends the entire film in agitated distress, driven to near madness and obsession to the point of overlooking facts in the drive to find his child and execute justice. I was intrigued by the trailer. Most trailers seem to cherry pick dramatic or intense scenes to put their best foot forward. Beware! A trailer does not a movie make. I was confused when the story jumped around and left some plot points unresolved. In my opinion a good movie has a beginning, middle and end. This story's ending was vague, leaving me with more questions than answers.
Very violent and disturbing, so know what you are getting into. This is definitely not for kids. Still, a must see if you like thrillers!!
It's a story of how crazy the people on the outside of the crazy house are and what a parent will do for there kids

Nine things about Prisoners

1. This is a dark psychological thriller about two girls who are kidnapped.

2. It starts off like one of those typical I must find my daughter! films. I was afraid it would be boring.

3. It eventually turns out to be closer to Silence of the Lambs. It wasn't even close to being boring.

4. Hugh Jackman plays one of the fathers and Jake Gyllenhaal plays the detective. Each of them follows different leads to find the girls, with different results. The audience is left to decide for themselves which man  if either of them  is doing the right thing.

5. Ive always been a fan of Gyllenhaal, and he is right on point here. Hes intense, layered, and commands the screen every time hes on.

6. Ive always been kind of meh about Jackman, but he surprised me with this. He has a fiercely raw emotion that makes you believe the lengths to which hell go to find his daughter. This is the best, most mature role Ive ever seen him in.

7. The movie is almost two-and-a-half hours long, which gives plenty of time for the story and characters to marinate and come together. It repeatedly takes turns that I wasn't expecting.

8. It is well written, not only as a thriller, but as a psychological examination of two complicated men and the demons who drive them.

9. It was originally rated NC-17 for being extremely violent. It was edited down to get an R-rating, but its still disturbing.

This movie is an absolute mind thriller. Without giving away the plot, from the moment in which the movie starts until it ends, the producers garbs your attention by opening with a doubt, continues with an acceleration of adrenaline, and ends with the most surprising ending. While I usually do not watch long movies, this one is over two hours long, I must say that it seems quite short - the time just flew wondering where would the movie take me next. Besides that, the photography and the camera plays an excellent role by placing ideas which makes the watcher ponder on what might happen next. This movie is worth the time and rental fees.

Great movie!  I took one star for the ending.  We should have at least been able to see the dad rescued and reunited with his daughter.  I know it is presumed but after all that we should have got to witness it.
Very exciting and thrilling movie. Surprises along the movie and unexpected ending. Worth watching. Would recommend it to all movie watchers
The movie was will written and great acting!  I would recommend everyone to see this movie. The ending was exciting.

I find the Amazon screen very difficult to work with
Unable to get to the bottom of the screen to return or back

I had heard so much about this movie so I expected a lot when I finally got the chance to see it. The acting was pretty solid and the plot was fine yet fairly predictable. When you have a movie like this, it just gets obvious that the main suspect didn't have a direct hand in the crime. It had to be someone we were exposed to and so the mystery was gone fairly early. In any event, it was enjoyable to watch.
It's so great to see a really well done film. It's a true thriller....well acted, good dialogue and plot. My only complaint is that it's a tad longer than it had to be.

This movie was well done;;;It had a committed father with a strong belief in God;;though it wavered a bit at times;;;Yet he let his emotions drive him to commit a similar kind of crime and sin that had been just done to him;;;but he justified his actions as 'the end justifies the means;;;and no other way to find the truth. It was a real shock and surprise to see the retarded villian's mother as the evil maniac deranged by what she thought God had done to her and her family. Truly evil and well portrayed by that actress, which in my view should qualify her for a 'best supporting " consideration. I have some minor criticisms;;such as I would like to have seen more development of the connection between the '2 crazy brothers who had been abused and warped by the insane bitch that was their foster mother who had kidnapped them as children.;;;But all in all the movie reminded me of a great "Hitchcock" thriller.
I thought it was an excellent movie..kind of about the depths a family would go thru if they thought they knew there abductor.
This movie was very suspense filled throughout!  It held our attention at every turn!  I would definitely recommend this movie!
Tough to watch if you have kids, but a very well made movie. My wife and I enjoyed the movie.

I approached this expecting a good solid but unremarkable thriller. What I got, wondrously, was a terrifically surprising soul wrenching and a soaringly aching slab of brilliance! From Jackman's best performance ever, to Jake Gyllenhall's masterfully subtle cop to Melissa Leo's "you can't top me" bravura acting----this is a dark thriller that makes its 2 1/2 hour length RACE by! Gorgeously written
and directed, be sure to see this as it towers over much lesser work like AMERICAN HUSTLE! A five star powerhouse!

I'll keep this short and sweet. This is the best movie I've seen in at least 5 years. It makes for very disturbing viewing. In fact, it may be the most disturbing film you'll ever see. I'm a grown man, and I was brought close to tears several times. But it's worth the pain.
This movie tackles an extremely sensitive subject matter expertly and respectively. It is also a technical achievement regarding story-telling, movie-making, and acting in general. It is a movie without any glaring flaw whatsoever. The acting is phenomenal across the board. No weak links. The story is artfully crafted, and masterfully paced. I could go on and on about it.
This is an elite film. It's relevance and emotional delivery, combined with near-perfect execution of the movie-making craft, place this film among the highest echelon. Think Schindler's List. Think Munich. Just brace yourself. It isn't an easy experience the first time through.

As to the Reviewer that said this movie  was for the Simple Minded  that is offensive! You obviously  did not  understand this Story  You did not get it!!!  This movie is sooo worth the rent  Keeps  you  interested  and another person said there was to many stories  going on??????  HUH??  Ok!
The video jumped and paused through-out the movie.  Very disappointed as it made watching it annoying.  Also we were charged twice for it.

I thought this was a great movie that gives viewers awareness of their children whereabouts and how crazy people are in the world. Great acting still thought it would've been better if Hugh turned into wolverine when he was being a vigilante lol. The ending of this movie I didn't like but would recommend this to many.
It is a very captivating movie. Even though it was hard to watch at times I just couldn't turn away. Actors were fantastic
Great movie for a change.  Don't hesitate to rent.  Great acting all the way around and the ending was fantastic as well
this was a great movie, stayed interested through whole movie! would reccomend to others for watching it. a good movie.

Premis great, great writing with a great cast yet one setback: a case of, "decent to solid to great Acting... and the great Acting was done by one Actor alone, that of the Co-Star, the real deal JAKE GYLLENHAAL!!!

Even with an ensemble of high calibre Actors it would have been a tedious heavy watch without GYLLENHAAL. From the decent but perplexing performances by Howard, Bello and to my high surprise Jackman to 3 solid as always, needed performances by Davis, Leo and Dano to the GREAT performance of, which is now his 2nd demonstration of the true craft of acting, JAKE GYLLENHAAL!!!

While Jackman never ceases to amaze us his performance was overplayed and pushed drama while on the opposite end of the spectrum Howard and Bello both dove into underplayed drama. Holding these performances afloat only long enough to take a deep breath were the solid performances of Dano, Davis and Leo. As always, Viola and Leo were pitch perfect adding just enough diversion.

BUT THE CAT WHOM KEPT THIS FILM ALIVE, STEADY AND MORE THAN WORTH THE WAIT, FOR ONE OF THE BEST WRITTEN ENDINGS TO A FILM, IS GYLLENHAAL. EVEN WITH DANO DAVIS AND LEO THIS FILM WOULD HAVE FALLEN SLOWLY INTO A DEEP DARK HOLE OF DEPRESSION RATHER THAN A WELL WRITTEN TRAGEDY IF NOT FOR GYLLENHAAL.

BY FAR THE BEST PEFORMANCE IN THIS FILM LIFTING IT FROM BEING HELD AFLOAT TO FLAT OUT SOURING WAS GIVEN BY GYLLENHAAL. A SILENT FORCE TO BE RECKONED WITH, GYLLENHAAL'S CHOICES WERE SUBLIMELY SUBTLE YET BREATHTAKING, FIST CLENCHING AND GUTTERALY HEARTBREAKING CREATING AN UTTERLY MEMORIZING PERFORMANCE. ALL DUE TO GYLLENHAAL'S CONVICTION TO THIS DETECTIVE'S INNER TURMOIL SITTING IN A SELF STRUCTURED PRISON!

GYLLENHAAL MARKED TERRITORY THROUGHOUT THIS FILM SO MUCH SO YOU ALMOST FORGET ABOUT ANYONE ELSE INCLUDING THE LOST GIRLS AND HE DOES SO WITHOUT TAKING FROM THE OTHER ACTORS NOR THE WRITING - THE CAT SIMPLY IMBEDDED HIMSELF IN THE CANVAS OF THIS FILM USING THE CRAFT TO PERFECTION CREATING HIS CHARACTER - WHAT MADE ME BUY THE FILM WAS JAKE AND HE ALONE COMPELLS ME TO WATCH IT AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN - FROM THE MOMENT HE APPEARS ON SCREEN ALL WE WANT TO KNOW IS, WHO THIS DETECTIVE? IS WHAT HAPPENED TO HIM? WHAT GAVE HIM THE ABILITY, THE DRIVE, THE PATIENCE TO CRACK EVERY CASE...?  LEAVING US BEGGING THE WRITER TO TELL US JUST SOMETHING, ANYTHING - OF THE WRITER DESERVES SERIOUS CREDIT AS WELL MAINLY FOR CREATING GYLLENHAAL'S ROLE.

THE TITLE IS "PRISONERS" BUT THE TITLE SHOULD BE "PRISONER" BECAUSE THERE IS ONLY ONE PRISONER IN THIS FILM, THE DETECTIVE JAKE GYLLENHAAL!

GYLLENHAAL SHOULD BE RECOGNIZED FOR THIS PERFORMANCE - I PRAY HE DOES - WHERE HAS THIS JAKE BEEN?  I DONT KNOW BUT JAKE IS HERE NOW! THE CRAFT OF ACTING NEEDS HIM, FILM NEEDS HIM AND WE NEED HIM. FILMMAKERS, DIRECTORS, WRITERS AND PRODUCERS NEED TO TAKE A HARD LOOK AND GRAB THIS CAT WHILE THEY CAN!!!

with respect to all the Artists involved in this film,
lucia ballard

I'm a fan of almost everyone in the cast and thought they, as well as the cast members with whom I was not familiar, delivered excellent performances. This movie has you questioning what you would or could do in certain situations, if or when you'd give up your present course, as well as how some people could live in particular situations. Some of it is a bit graphic, so be careful. Everything makes sense in the end.

From the one preview I saw this movie is definitely not what I thought it was going to be, although still a good movie. From my perspective of the preview I believed there was going to be a lot more action and confrontations between enemies. There are things you have to pay close attention to, to understand parts, but even if you don't, Hugh Jackman's character will do sort of a recap near the end and everything will be understood. The way it ended kinda upsets me because it's one of those endings where you can think "ok that's all, there won't be a sequel" or you can think "oh man, why did you do that me, now I have to anxiously wait for the sequel". Anyway it's a good movie.
A movie you can really get into. Worth renting. You think what would I do in this situation but in the end did I make a mistake?

I had been looking forward to this movie from the reviews but it turned out to be extremely tedious, going on forever, with implausible settings (one policeman acting without any apparent backup or partner  to cover a two child abduction? Really?), wooden performances, and no tension whatever. Really disappointed. Endless rain does not a drama make.

I enjoyed this flic very much, and found only a couple parts in the movie that were made a bit too obvious to my taste. Some may not agree.
It took twists and turns which I love, and I found the very end to be a perfect way to finish the film.
It is worth watching!
Definitely has some good twists and is not a show suitable for children. I would definitely see this movie again.
Excellent movie and I would not consider this in my collection shelf. Amazon has great shows online and I will continue using it.

If you like intense stories, you will definitely like this one.  Be prepared to jump and sometimes scream at your TV.  Hugh Jackman is fantastic as a frustrated father who will do ANYTHING (even if it's illegal) to find his daughter and the daughter of his best friend.  Definitely a winner!
Suspenseful and intense. Good plot twists with excellent performances. The characters and story play as  you are witnessing a real life drama.
Gripping. Tight construction. Superb performance by Hugh Jackman. Every parent's nightmare sets the stage and gets more tangled from there.
Great movie kept my attention but could have ended different.  Over all a great movie and highly recommend to watch

This movie is very i good.
Loved the acting the actor I just love everything about the movie I would recommend this to anyone is worth watching it.
You will not be disappointed.
Lots of twists and turns!  I thought it was a really good movie and the ending was not expected. : )
awesome movie and probably the best movie for 2013. Hugh Jackman was amazing. I could not leave my seat and I could not blink for over 2 hours. loved it!

This film, while somewhat bland, makes up for its lack of an original hook with great acting, well-shot scenes, suspense, empathy and overwhelming motifs of mysticism and faith. One of 2013's most over-looked films.

Every once in awhile a movie comes along that demands our attention. This is one of those movies. If you enjoy a suspenseful movie, this movie is a must see. Too often we see a statement about a movie stating this movie will keep you on the edge of your seat, and the suspense turns out to be second rate. Take a look at this movie. It will keep your heart thumping until you reach a totally unexpected ending. The acting is superb, and the director has put together a masterpiece. Too bad it will not get an Oscar mention...

Not many ways to be clever with this story...however the characters and acting could be focused on and embraced.  The story did have interesting edges to it.  I found it worth my time and money.  Hugh Jackman of course is acting well done and Mark Wahlberg was a producer and for me those are great credentials.

Predictable all the way to the ending, if you pay attention to the in-your-face foreshadowing. Gyllenhaal was methodic but his character was flat. Jackman was good, although too much emphasis was put on his doomsday prepping when it didn't really make any difference to the story. I rented it, and I'm glad, because I can't think of a time where I'll be inspired to watch it again. Wasn't terrible, just didn't hit it for me.
This is a great movie. It's hard to watch at times, which makes it very realistic. Hugh Jackman and Jake Gyllenhal are both excellent. I highly recommend it!!!
Great movie, my family enjoyed it.  I did not think it was too violent. Nice plot twists. I would highly recommend.
Kept me om the edddggggggeee very good movie its hard to find good movies theses days i always have to go back and watch old movies

Gripping- suspensful....heart wrenching on many levels.
It was hard to watch snd not to watch.
Worth the $4.00 pkus more....I wish I would have had popcorn!!!

I saw this film in theatres, when it first came out. It was amazing!! My sister got this dvd for me for Christmas, and I loved watching it again!

The bonus features were a bit disappointing...I guess since I'm a film junkie I was hoping for behind-the-scenes B-roll footage or something, but otherwise, they were good. Basically, the features held interviews with the cast, and how they prepared for their roles, etc.

If you've never seen this movie, here's a bit of a rundown about content: It's violent and there's a lot of language. The violence can be disturbing, but it's realistic. The language is not gratuitous; it's real life. F word is used quite a lot.

Hugh Jackman is incredible in this film. The emotion he brings to the character is astounding. Likewise, I've never enjoyed Jake Gyllenhaal more than in this movie! The entire cast is phenomenal. The shots used, in junction with the lighting and music (which is epic & fitting), make for a fantastic film. The script alone is incredible.

This film is...just awesome.  Trust me. You should get it :-)
Great movie, refreshingly original thriller.  If your a movie buff this is a must see. Great performances from hugh jackman and Jake.

I'm sure that the acting was good but this is a very dark movie, both figuratively and literally. I guess it was an artistic decision but even in a fairly dark room, it was hard to see details on the screen. Halfway through, we paused and debated finishing it. We did finish and at the end, we wished we had made a different selection. As a fan of both Hugh Jackman and Jake Gyllanhaal, I was very disappointed.

Too many parallel stories going on at the same time and the abundance of 5-star actors made the focus of this movie get lost in the delivery. All are superb actors, the story would be good if there weren't so many improbable things going on on the side. I would not recommend this movie.
I highly recommend this for everyone! Will have you tearing up  almost the entire time..Very intense and good story line
It was not as good as they made it out to be. It was an ok rent movie but glad I did not see it in the theater
Wanted to see it when it came out in the theaters, but never got the chance.  Look forward to watching it again.

I would have given this five stars had they not ended it like that. Of course you assume that he gets him out of the hole and he goes to jail after being rescued, but for me the whole movie was about a father doing anything it takes to find his daughter, and there is no shot of them ever being reunited? Of course again you assume they were but ending with the whistle and not ever seeing any of that totally robs the audience of closure. The Directors got it wrong.

I watched this movie with no expectations as I've not wached a good movie in a long time. Most releases this year have been dissapointing, with only a few good movies here and there that are worth watching. Hugh jackman, Jake Gyllenhaal, viola davis, terrence jackson are superb in their roles.

Movies are for entertainment: I use my brain all day  at work and come home wanting to turn the brain off, this is entertaining and i didn't have to think too much watching this movie. So sit back, turn off the brain and enjoy. I would recommend watching this movie with no expectations and im sure you will enjoy.

This film is pretty complex.  Dark in town from start to finish, it definitely makes you think.  The title sums it up perfectly.  Great 'whodunit' if you can handle the dark tone.  Definitely worth watching with someone as you'll likely want to have someone to discuss it with after....
Unique. Engaging. Humanity in its deepest rawest form. Great watch. For the lack of publicity, I felt it was a superb film & performance.
Great Pic! I am so glad we rented this very interesting choice. We loved it!!! Can't wait to see more
The old lady , which is the aunt, is the kidnapper and both of the girls are found alive and well.

This movie was way too long in running time for what was pretty much a short story.  Lots of slow sections with tedious dialog and action scenes were more violence than needed to transmit the story.  Glad we paid the $4.00 after market price rather than on the big screen.  Disappointing considering the talent in the cast.
This movie had me interested for every single second that I watched it. The acting was great, the story wasn't too predictable, and visually it was stunning.

Wow, very surprised and impressed with this film.  I heard a lot of word of mouth hype and I am skeptical when that happens.  Also, I have a young child and was avoiding this film as I felt it would be hard for me emotionally to watch.  It was (difficult to stomach at times), but the film makes efforts to tread lightly around the abduction, and no terrorization, violence, pain, etc. involving children was shown or explicitly referenced.  The best acting in either Jackman's or Gyllenhall's careers...Oscar level output for both, it will be a shame if at least a nomination doesn't come.  Clever writing, plot twists, and general creepiness will keep you glued.
I am now a Hugh Jackman fan and Jake G...both terrific.  I might even watch it again. Watch this movie............. You, too, will say "yes".....!!

Supported by a super talented cast, this movie keeps you on the edge of your seat pretty much the whole time, trying to figure out what actually happened.  Even though its almost two and a half hours, the time flies by and you don't really notice it - because you are so engrossed in the mystery every second of it.  Its a masterfully told story - and i am surprised i have not heard much oscar buzz about this movie.  Highly recommended.
Interesting plot if not predicable. The good acting made up for the lack of suspense. Dialogue was easy to follow.

this movie totally pulls you in, the acting is awesome I am a avid true crime fan both in movies and books this was so suspenseful and well written it leaves somethings to the imagination like certain violence, it is not gore porn , which I hate theres no stomach turning images , I found the twists amazing and I'm usually the movie spoiler in the house because I see plot turns coming a mile away, not in this film though. great movie. and the ending does not level you hanging unless your a dummy lol its very very obvious what happens even though your not completely shown.
Gripping. Prisoner has plot twists that make the film entertaining and unpredictable.  Enjoyable for adults. This is not a film for children.
It is an edge of your seat thriller. It is nice and long also. I will watch it again. I would recommend this movie.

This is, by far, one of the best thrillers my husband and I have seen in years! We were both watching and listening intently until the very end. Hugh Jackman and Jake Gyllenhaal were absolutely terrific....perfect roles for both actors.
Highly recommend!!

I liked it!  Jake G. was fantastic - very edgy detective, very PA outskirts, Hugh J., father of one of the abducted girls,  gave you a lot to think about.  It is not uplifting nor do you laugh or smile in it.  It had a couple slow moments - but overall it kept you interested and at the end - what would you do?  Definitely an adult movie - not because of sex, nudity, or language - but violence and content.
